> The more cluttered the class or library is with public
> methods, the harder it is to understand and use the class.

I don't think that's true. I don't see how having an additional
org.something.util.CalendarParser class could make any library harder to
understand and use. Hell, that class could even be extracted to a different
binary, so that an outside developer wouldn't see it at all.

With other words, in my opinion you can make as many methods public as you
like without cluttering any API - if you do it right.

Cheers, Ilja
